answers.answer: I'm not sure the blood values you mention are related to your breast cancer or it's treatment. These things may be due to another medical issue and perhaps need the attention of an Internist or your family Dr.  I'm sure your Oncologist will make the proper recommendation.     Regards ....

I also have similar tests like yours, but for me I know it's my kidneys. I am also spilling protein in my urine. But if you are healthy and have no history of kidney disease or Diabetes, then something like you are reporting may be from a medication you are taking, or even the chemo.Some cancer treatment problems do go away after a while, but  it may even be something like the tamoxifen, as usually kidney problems, or the abnormal blood values you mention are a direct toxic effect from a medication and i have read this numerous times on medication inserts. Not that it will happen that but it could happen. Basically, my point here is that I don't know, or have a clue what this means in your case, but your doctor will either know, suspect, and/or find out. You may or may not need more testing.
Thanks Kat. I am also spilling out albumin in my urine. But I have no history of kidney disease or diabetes. My sugar tests are all normal.

You know, I am not sure if low values are always worrisome at all. Albumin is pretty much the same as protein. Are you eating enough protein? It may still be recovering from the radiation as well. I gained a lot of weight with chemo and then lost a lot with radiation. basically, I am trying to say that high values are more worrisome and I may have been overtired the other day and not totally read your question correctly. My mother always has low values with these tests but she is totally healthy. Her doctor told her to eat more protein and I am not sure how much value that advice had;  she lives in Austria.

Want to add one more thing, since I am senile from all this stuff that is/was similar to what you had, and are taking. Did they do a urine test as well? Because, if you are spilling albumin the serum levels would also be low, and that is the case with me, but I am sure your doctor would have told you that, or the report. Don't worry too much, OK? Kat
I am really sorry, r_g. you just said you were spilling albumin in your urine. What's wrong with my brain? I better shut up, but..oh, well!  (and I was a RN, just please don't tell anyone! LOL)

Hey Kat ! thanks so much. I saw my doctor and he said the same thing- increase the intake of proteins and repeat the test after four weeks(urine test). As my chlorides were high , he has also asked me to cut down on salts.I have gained lot of weight . I guess this is because of tamoxifen . There is lot of water retention in the body also I have a mild lymphedema (right arm). What should one do ?thanks.

question: Hi! I was diagnosed with BC (right) in the month of August 08.I have completed the treatment in april 09 ,which included Mestectomy(5 nodes positive),Chemo and radiation . On tamoxifen from Feb 09 onwards as I am ER/PR +ve . I had my follow up tests done. mamo normal . ultra sound of abdomen and pelvic is also normal. But serum creatinine, Albumin, blood urea nitrogen and total proteins show LOW values. Chloride shows High value. All the other parameters are normal. I am unable to comprehend the report. I am due to meet my doctor with the reports after two weeks. Till then if someone could help me understand.thanks
title: post BC treatment- blood and urine report
